evidence: Case results displayed with recent success (2024)
No negative reviews highlighted in research
Limited social media presence found during research
No active LinkedIn company profile visible in search
Professional networking through associations rather than social media
sources: Web search results, professional association verification

evidence: Employment law has medium conversion rates (~40-60%) for relevant automation
Specialized practice area sees value in efficiency improvements
Deadlines are critical (180-day EEOC), creating urgency
Small firms more likely to invest in automation than solo practitioners
sources: Historical prospect data, legal industry benchmarks

evidence: Employment law is specialized practice area
Phoenix has many employment law firms (30+ in directory)
Few automation competitors specifically targeting employment law
Big firms (100+ attorneys) not target for mid-market automation
Small firms (1-5 attorneys) often can't afford comprehensive automation
Tagline: 'Righting wrongs - one case at a time'
Explicitly serves employers, executives, and employees
Practice areas well-defined (wrongful termination, discrimination, harassment, unpaid wages)
Contact form available on website at /contact-us/
No direct email addresses publicly listed
Physical address not prominently displayed on main pages
Map integration shown suggesting in-person availability

trustScoreCalculation.interpretation: Solid prospect with specialized focus and good conversion potential. Clear positioning and employment law expertise. Moderate contact effort due to limited social presence and lack of public email.

bonuses.reason: Strict 180-day EEOC deadlines create high-stakes urgency for automation

adjustments.reason: Small team (3 attorneys) enables fast implementation with high ROI

confidenceReasoning: Website provides good detail on services and team. Lawyer.com verifies size and ratings. Limited public information about company size beyond attorney count indicates private ownership.
